lines.name: MATT
lines.text: (heavy sigh) Every goddamn week. Anyway! Before we jump into the craziness of tonight's episode, let's get through some quick announcements, here! First and foremost, merch update. Laura, what do we got?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: The

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: They're shipping soon, right?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: We love you, and you will get them! The ones that aren't signed will get shipped out a little bit faster.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: So one day for those.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: One more day! (singing) One!

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Tell your friends! Tell your wives!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Perfect. Next update, we have Wednesday Club for next week.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Wednesday Club! We're in an interesting transition point for a lot of shows on Geek and Sundry, so we thought we'd have a card party. It's not as sexy as it sounds.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: I disagree, sir!

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Are you in? Are you down?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yeah, I am!

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: We're opening card packs!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: I'm going to be there for this!

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: You want to come?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Can we all come and open card packs?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Will you also someday have a Pog episode?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: We already did a Pog episode.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Shut your mouth!

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: We actually made it rain Pogs! It was great! You can come. We're going to have another Pog party!

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: You'll have lots of time after this, Liam!

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Definitely Matt, and there's going to be a bunch of people showing up; it's going to be great!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: That's so much of my childhood, you have no idea.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: What kind of cards?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Doomsday cards.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Any Marvel Masterpiece?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Unopened. We've got some Kirby cards, some classic Avengers cards. We're doing a little bit of everything. We've got a couple we're working on, though. Marvel Universe Series One of Three is what we're really working on.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: I'll talk more about it on the show, but I have a long history with those cards. All righty! Thank you, Taliesin! Signal Boost, I believe we had our recent episode went up this week with our fantastic Ashley Johnson! (cheering)

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: It was so good!

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Boosting Taliesin!

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Taliesin, you looked taller in that Signal Boost.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I was wearing smaller people on my feet, so it helped.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: He learned from the last episode, if you stack them in a trenchcoat.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I just thought of four people that fit that bill and decided not to say any of their names.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: We had been planning for that episode, I remember talking to Marisha. I was like, I kind of want to boost Taliesin. We were like, everybody knows who Taliesin is.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Even if they've been goosed a bit.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: They're peppered in between. The beauty of that is you're not sure which ones are true and which ones aren't! They're back and forth. The bees are true.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: The bees are true.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Two more people have to die before you eventually become the most interesting man in the world.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: One now.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: One now? That's right.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: That's dark, but that's where we are.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: The guy who's running Canada is very young, so we're going to have to wait a while.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Which we're super excited about. For those who were here for International Tabletop day, Ivan van Norman ran me, Taliesin, Satine Phoenix, Amy Dallen, Amy Vorpahl through a very intense game of Dread, all being late 80s, early 90s high school kids going up to a cabin experience, and it was awesome. Well, we made a show! It was amazing.

lines.name: TALIESIN, MARISHA
lines.text: It's so good!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It's genuinely one of the coolest experiences I've ever had as a player in a game.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I feel like we invented a new form of theater; it's weird.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: What's the code?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: SHIPMATES.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: SHIPMATES.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Only today, though. Today's the last day.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Until tomorrow.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You have until tomorrow to try it out, so if you're like, "I don't want to pay for Alpha!" Well, you don't have to for 60 days now! Just put SHIPMATES in, and you'll be fine.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: This is the first time I've ever said this out loud: Seriously, go check out Alpha for this show. It's worth it. It's amazing. Oh my god!

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Adam Lawson was the director. Sean and I were the producers.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Is there any nudity?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I have a lot of feelings about this show.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: What's on your mind, Sam?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Nothing. The power's out at my house! Just distracted because I just came from my house, and the power was out, that's all. I'm worried about my kids. Are they going to have their little fans on tonight to keep them cool? Are they going to light candles in their room? I don't know!

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Are they watching Twitch by candlelight?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: They are definitely watching Twitch.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Can they have a pillow fort in the living room?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Maybe, if they can find the living room. It's

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Just hear the sound of a wine aerator in the background.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: They aerate their milk.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: However, due to the magical defenses of the tower top, where the rituals were being completed, it seems the top of the tower was untouched by the spells, and lowered itself to the rubble of where it once stood. You then mustered your forces, rode up to the top of the lip of what remains of Entropis and joined in battle against Delilah Briarwood, a death knight, and the physical form of Vecna, the Whispered One himself. However, the battle did not turn in your favor, and in the process of the battle--

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: That's debatable.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Is it?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Vax, not with you, and Vex, realizing, asked the question:

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Where's Vax?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I walk up to her and I set down his armor and don't say anything.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: What's this? Where is he?!

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: There's nothing left. He was obliterated.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Disintegrated.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: What?!

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I saw it happen, and then I saw it happen.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: And we just left him there?!

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: No, we brought--

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: We brought everything we could.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh god! No!

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I'm so sorry.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I was brought back and his soul is just-- where?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: That's the ultimate question, isn't it?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Can you bring him back?

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: I don't know if I can.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Can you, Keyleth?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I've never done this before.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I go over and gather up all of his armor and start hugging it to myself.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I recently learned a spell that I could attempt, but it's nothing I've tried before, and it's expensive, and I'm already terrified of the fate and the hell that I might have brought him in his final moments.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Well, what is it?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I think he saw himself die. I think. I'm so sorry.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: What are you talking about?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I cast Foresight on him. And I think there was a thing for a second. I haven't thought of those ramifications of something like that before. I think he was held and there was nothing he could do. What if that happened? What if he saw himself die?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Then it doesn't matter yet, until we bring him back.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Only matters what we do next, right?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Let's bring him back.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: What's this new spell you were talking about?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I need 25,000 gold pieces worth of diamonds.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: What?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I need 25--

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Not just gold, you need diamonds?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Where are we?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I don't have-- I don't have that!

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: We're in the Feywild.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: We can find it, then.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You see the tips eventually coming to a midnight blue at the edge. There's a very faint mist that has gathered across the ground that stands about knee-height. The ground beneath you seems to have a somewhat crunchy sponginess to it with each step, though you cannot see where your feet actually touch the ground.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Is it all diamonds?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: (owl hooting)

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: We're going to find these diamonds.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Was it her? Or was it Vecna?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: It--

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Grog? Can you put her in the bag? And I toss him the body.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: As the body of Delilah Briarwood, the head still scattered and divided right around the forehead, this giant cleft of her skull hemisphere is gone. Whatever matter was once there has loosely fallen out as she's been dragged from one location. You do see the left eye, which is not human, it seems, in appearance. The white is instead a sickly greenish-yellow, and the pupil is a cat-like slit of black, surrounded by a thin, greenish-blue tint. As soon as you look down and see the face, the eye which just looks upward at nothing, the dead body still, the eye twitches and shifts to look at you.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Oh! (unhappy humming) Her fucking eye is still moving.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Should we take it out?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Yes. It could be Vecna, watching us.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Does it look reptilian?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Can you put it in a bag or something? Cover it up?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Wait, can I take a closer look at it and see if I can, I don't know, identify it somehow?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Do you have an Identify spell?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: No, but can I just see?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Make an arcana check.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Sure. Two! Plus five.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: As you get down close to glance at the rather disturbingly bloodied face of Delilah Briarwood, the eye shifts back towards you. The closer you get, you watch as the thinning slit of the pupil seems to widen and focus on you. It's an unsettling presence. As you try and concentrate to see if there's any immediate signs of whether it be sigils or arcane marks that would mark it to be more of a magically enchanted object than an actual organic eye, nothing comes to mind other than the fact that it seems to be very intent on studying you back.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Can I try to remove it from the ocular cavity?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Using your fingers?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Yeah. My tiny, ocular hands.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay. Go ahead and make an athletics check.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Nine.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay, you (slurping).

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I can inspire myself, I suppose.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: If you want to. Up to you. How many more bardic inspirations do you have after the battle?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Those count as inspiration, right?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yeah. Your fingers are now knuckle-deep in Delilah Briarwood's socket.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I'll inspire myself just to give it a serious try. That's plus ten, so that's a 19 plus, I guess, three for Jack of All Trades?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: If you're not trained in it, then yeah.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You begin humming your favorite eye-pulling song under your breath and with a horrible sucking sound, you pull the eye from her socket, leaving this trail of dark black and red viscera that dangles from it loosely. As you pull it free, whatever attached the eye to it seems to burn off and fall, leaving just the circular socket. I also need you to roll a wisdom saving throw.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Oh no! Insta-death.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: You're fine.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: No, I'm not. Oh, is this magic?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It's not a magic spell, I'd say it's a magic effect, yeah.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Do I get advantage?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: I'll say, as a gnome, for this, yes, you would.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Way better, but still terrible. 12!

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: How bad was your first one?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: A one!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: And it's so simple. It's so simple!

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Could we smack the eye out of his hand?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: As this is happening, you watch as he's looking at it and this hand goes up and starts clawing into his own eye socket.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I'm going to use every dex I have. I'm going to slap fucking hard.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Dex isn't going to help you so much as it's going to be a strength thing. Go ahead and make an athletics check. For you, for this, this would be an acrobatics to try and dodge out of the way.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Strength check?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Athletics.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Oh, athletics, that's better.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You're trying to slap it out of his grasp.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You slap and the hand pulls back a little bit and he yanks it back. You can see a trail of blood beginning to pool out of the corner of the eye.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Can I try to grab his hand and slap him across the face?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yeah. This is the last chance anybody has to try and do this or Scanlan loses an eye. We're going into Event Horizon moment, here. Go ahead and make an athletics check.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Roll an acrobatics check.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: It's the same thing, so it's 13.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: As his fingers are digging into the socket and the other eye's just staring at this piercing circular gaze in his grasp in his right. You see the blood beginning to trail down his face in two different places. He's gotten his fingers partway behind his own eye. You rush up and grab him by the wrist, put your other hand right at the front of his face, pushing his nose and cheek up. You pull it back and you watch as, from behind the eyelid, his fingers slip out. He's fighting it with all his might. As you pull back, as soon as you get it free, with your other hand, you backhand. You knock the eye out of his other hand, and it goes (falling noise) and disappears beneath the mist.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Can we see where it landed?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Yeah, I'm going to follow the eye.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Do not touch it, Percy!

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Can I see?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: The throbbing pain, and you're not able to focus in this eye at the time. You're effectively unable to see out of this eye really well until your next long rest. It's pretty damaged just from the brief grabbing. You could try to heal him, if you want. Your mind comes back to you for a minute. You're like, "What the fuck is wrong with me?!"

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: What were you doing?!

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: It was speaking to me.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: What did it say?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I don't exactly remember, but it had some really strong arguments.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Was it telling you to pull your own fucking eye out?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I guess, yeah. It was offering me things. It was telling me it could help. I've never felt that way before. It was amazing.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Ew. Where did it go?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You said you were going to look in the mist for it?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: No, I'm not. Just holding onto--

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: The remains of Vax.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Keyleth goes over to Vex and curls up into her.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: 14. As you dive over in the direction of where you think you saw it go, the mist is thick, and you start pushing it away, and there is very dense underbrush and foliage that is gathered here that created the crunchy floor. Glancing through and pushing around, there's no sign of the eye.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I need help finding it. I need help! Be very careful.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I come over and start helping him look.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I've got the flashlight box out, and I'm going to try and use this as a container if we find it.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay. You're not using the actual light, you're using the box? The thickness in the mist right now, the light would probably hinder your search than help it.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Keyleth, can you thin this? We need to see. Make the mist go away.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: What?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: (louder) Can you make the mist go away?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I don't know.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Can you try?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I half-heartedly do a Gust cantrip while still sitting next to Vex.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Like a lot of things in the Feywild, it almost has its own sense of nature and purpose. It's not going to let someone push itself back if it wishes to exist on the forest floor. As you're rushing in to help, because you've already made the investigation check and the mist is rolling in, and based on his inability to find it, you're not even quite sure where it landed. Make your own investigation check, but you're at disadvantage.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Three.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay. Over the next three or four minutes, as you guys pat through and tear roots apart and sections of the forest floor, there is no sign of where the eye landed.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: If I were to cast Locate Object, would that work?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You can certainly try.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Okay!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You go over and grab your holy symbol and kneel to the ground, focus on whatever this dark relic is that seems to have plagued you in two different ways in the past ten minutes. As you concentrate, you feel the divine light of Sarenrae come and restore warmth from the center of this cold forest. You feel the energy flow through you and the image of her face descending from above, her mouth opening and she exhales this breath over you, and as it does, you suddenly can clarify your visual perception on this object. You know exactly the direction it is. You start walking in that direction. You push past Grog and push past Percival. You find a portion of the ground and you look, and it's not there, but you know it's that direction.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: I think I've located it. I can't see it, but I know what direction it's in.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Is it beneath the ground? Is it invisible?

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: I don't know. So it seems like it's in the ground or it's been moved.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Trying to push aside the mist in the area, and it's all closed in now. The Gust cantrip held back what it could while you cast the spell.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I seem them moving in that direction, and once again, poof for them.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: The mist separates again. You look, and you can see the direction where it would be, and as you glance over and focus your attention, it looks like between two of the roots, there's a portion of fresh dirt.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: It burrowed!

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Okay, can I start digging?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You start scooping in.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I have the box out, ready.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It began to burrow. You see it glancing about. The eye is flickering around like it's rapidly trying to find a way out.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: I put it in the box.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You close the box.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I don't trust that thing.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: The burrowing eyeball? Are you

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Holy shit!

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I mean, I don't trust it near us.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: That's my favorite thing you've ever said.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Percy, I think you need to give it to me to hold.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I think that's a terrible idea.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: No, I can take care of it better than you.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: What makes you think that?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Just give it to me. Trust me.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: You're bleeding out your eye right now!

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I want revenge on this eye. Give it to me so I can get revenge!

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Hold on. I cast Cure Wounds for his eye.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yeah. The eye wasn't removed from the socket, but the damage that was around it seems to have healed up from the mild Cure Wounds. There's still the drying blood that has pooled down the cheek, but it appears that most of the initial damage has been sealed.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Do you want me to hold it?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I kind of want you to hold it.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I think I should hold it.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: I feel like I'm going to hold onto it in case it tries to attach itself to you again and you pull out your eyeball again.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Yes, and that thing should be difficult to get out of. It it is a big case.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: What if it can still hear us? Sense where we are?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: It's an eyeball; it doesn't have ears.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: That is true. That is a very good point.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: And Delilah.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Oh yeah, she still goes in the bag, right?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Oh, yeah. We're going to want to have a word with her later.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Even beyond the diamonds.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: The two of you, I need both of you here.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Of course, darling.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: This was supposed to be a weekend trip.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Nothing is ever what it's supposed to be.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Just a weekend trip.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I know. Let's get this done.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Even after we find 25,000 gold pieces worth of diamonds, I've never brought anyone back before, and this is versus the Raven Queen. How do we know if his soul is even available for return?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: How do we know that she is against us? This was Vecna. She may still be with us.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I can't believe I left his soul over there, alone.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: We didn't.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I did. I came back.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: We're not done.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Maybe we should talk to the Raven Queen.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: How do you do that?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: There's a temple in Vasselheim, and there's a temple in Whitestone.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Same way that he did.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: We need to find diamonds. Can we find them while we're here? Can we find them where we are?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I don't know how you find diamonds in the Feywild.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Percy, don't you know the Feywild?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Where are we?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Do we see any structures off in the distance, or is it all just overgrowth?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You've not been to this part of the Feywild.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Maybe our werewolf friends are still around.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yeah, I was going to say I have a terrible idea. I think they wanted to leave, so what if they know of some hidden treasure trove around here? That could, you know, tit for tit.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: If we go to a city.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: If we rest, I may be able to make them.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: 25,000 gold worth of diamonds.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: How big is that?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: It could be a lot of smaller diamonds.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: But how big? How many?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I'll pull out one diamond that I have that's worth 1,500 gold.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I feel within a tinker theory is how figuring out how much diamonds--

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: We would need 20 more of these.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It can range based on the purity of the diamond, how well it's been cut. You can make an intelligence check, if you'd like.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: That'll do. I feel like this would be in the wheelhouse.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I have to blow my nose again.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: God, I am rolling just the worst. 13.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: 13. I mean, that's a lot of diamonds. That can range, depending on the purity and where in the world they're found. There's a standard amount when it comes to magic practices that aren't tailored to the cultural variations of cost. You couldn't ask somebody, "Sell me these diamonds, "but for six times the cost," you know. It wouldn't help the spell occur. That's the general equivalent to the amount of diamonds that are consumed required for his spell. You've never seen that many diamonds in one place.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: We don't have a body, so we're basically making a diamond Vax.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I know where there are diamonds.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Where?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I can make them. We just need an animal.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: How much can you make?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: As much as the animal.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Ooh, the bigger the animal, the bigger the diamonds?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I can make animals.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I mean, I know you're grieving, but we could give Trinket up for this.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I can make animals.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Scanlan.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: It was worth a try.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: You're such a shithead.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: There is a second thought, if this does not go well. Which was-- there was one place where we saw that many diamonds in one place before: Thordak.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Surely they've cleaned all that up by now, right?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: There's enough there. It didn't get randomly distributed. I'm sure that they have it, and I'm sure that we can make a deal.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Take a loan?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I have something worth money.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Was it a bad idea?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Taking out a loan?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yeah!

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: To buy diamonds?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: We have gold. We have plenty of gold.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: What did Kraghammer mine? What was their deal?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All sorts of things. Many precious metals, gems, stone that was used for crafting, hewing into various forms of masonry. Anything that could be reaped from beneath the Cliffkeep Mountains, that's what Kraghammer specialized in.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: What if we go to a mine? We could go straight to a source, buy direct?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: We could go to Kraghammer and buy, or we could try doing what Scanlan said.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I can't do anything today.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Should we get back to our world?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: We go to Kraghammer, rest there.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: We can't. We have to sleep before, unless there's a portal nearby that we can get through.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Did you send us to the pond? I thought you took us to the pond.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: It has to be nearby. Plane Shift is general. I pick an area, and it gambles where it's going to drop us.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: And did you specify the location?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I did! I said the Shademirk Bog and the pond, the glade. I found the page in my notes and rambled all the names off very quickly in a panic.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: What's interesting, when last you were in the Shademirk, you recall this being a very oil-thickened forest.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh, you took us to where Saundor was. You didn't take us to the pond with the chick?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Correct, this is the Shademirk. This is where you battled with Saundor. However, the forest you're in now, if this is indeed the same location, it seems to have vastly recovered from the corruption that Saundor's presence gave, which is why it's both unfamiliar to you and not as oppressive as the last time you visited.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Didn't we-- nope. I Plane Shifted us out.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: We have to spend the night here. Vecna's in our world.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Vecna's in a box.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: How much power does he get from that eye?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: More than all of us combined, I'd imagine.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: If it burrows in the ground, it can't break out of the box, right?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I don't know.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Open the box and see what it's doing.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: We can look in the box without.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Give it to me. I'll take care of it. I'll send it away to a place where only I can get it.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Can I take a peek?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yeah, you open it up. You hold it back and hold the door open.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: There's a glass thing so we can look through the glass.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Immediately, glancing in, you see it staring right back at you.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: (horrified wail)

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Don't send it to another plane; that's very fucking weird.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: But it's a personal plane. It's my plane.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Are you sure nobody else can ever get into it?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I am not.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Then no.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I don't know how this works. My daughter taught me this spell; I've never used it before.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Then, fuck it, we're not doing it.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I don't even know what that means!

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: That's really weird.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: What if it's the Vecna dimension?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Here, let's try something. Just give me something, I'll send it there now. I don't know what that'll do.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: How will we know it's there?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Give me Trinket.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: No! Stop it!

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I can't do Trinket. It has to be less than five pounds.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Less than five pounds?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Yes.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: It has to be something small?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Yeah.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: No! No, don't consider it Pike, no!

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Give me anything.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Do you want a pair of manacles?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Sure!

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Here's a pair of manacles.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: All right. I will use Wrist Pocket!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You watch as he holds the manacles and does a flourish with his hand and they vanish from sight.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: How do you know if they're there?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I don't know where they are! I literally have no idea, but watch this!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: They seem to apparate immediately into his grasp.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I don't know how I even do that!

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Cool. We're not using a random-ass magic trick on an eyeball.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Did you just point at me and tell me to come to you so you can make me disappear and come back?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: No! The eye! I can get rid of the eye!

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Fuck off!

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Maybe we should vote on this. Should we give it to me? Who says aye?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: You can buy my vote.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I don't have that much.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Yes, you do. You can buy my vote.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I don't have enough.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Are there any animals around?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Make a nature check.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Natural 20.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You're familiar with forests, definitely, and you can see telltale signs of scurrying, telltale signs of track marks in the ground, feces left behind by living creatures. You do see signs of things that live throughout these forests everywhere.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Anything that looks like it would be the size of an adult deer or something?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Doe, a deer? A female deer?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I'm thinking a male deer. Yes, a stag. A white stag. Any stag, really, just an animal that's big.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You see a number of tracks that would resemble creatures of that size or larger. Some seem bear-like, some seem larger than that, though similar claws and heavy footprints. Some that are smaller and skittery. You see there was a small cluster of what might be deer-like creatures, but you're not quite sure what the tracks are. There's plenty of life that wanders through here. Apparently, since you've arrived, none that seem bold enough to approach you too closely in this clustered clearing you're in. Can't even call it a clearing, because you maybe have a total of ten feet you're all crammed into at this time.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: If we howl, right?

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Are we down?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Yeah, we haven't healed since--

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: We are wrecked.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: How's everybody doing?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I'm low.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Aren't you low, Pike? Like 11 or something.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I mean, we're about to rest. You're probably super low.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: I think am, let's see if I wrote it down here. Oh, yeah! I forgot! I'm almost dead.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Trinket's unconscious still in my necklace.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Okay.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: He's unconscious. I pop him out, if you're going to heal us.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: (magic noise)

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Aw, buddy.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I start crying again.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I turn him into diamonds.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: You dick! You're such an asshole.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right, so what are you guys doing?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Pike's going to heal us.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Heal and sleep.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I'm going to kill something.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Let Keyleth make something big.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: What are you casting, Pike?

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Mass Cure Wounds.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Mass Cure Wounds? All right, go for it.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Will it work on a magical animal, or does it have to be a real animal?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: No, it can work on anything, I think. I've never turned anything into diamonds.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: If I had that, I'd be doing that all the time.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: You're right. In retrospect, I should have been doing this literally every day. I just learned the spell a week ago.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Why are you dealing drugs? Just be like boop!

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Yeah, but look at this! It's gone! It's back! Cool, right?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: And think how useful that will come in the bedroom. Manacles! Nobody? Cool.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I was like, pocket dimension?

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: You all heal 31 points. It's something.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: 31? All of us?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Everyone healed 31. Trinket gets up, (bear grumbling).

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Yeah. Hey, Trink.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: You guys need more healing? I could try to give us more.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: We're going to rest. Are we safe to leave fucking-- there's nothing we can do, at this point-- to leave Vecna in the world. We can't do anything!

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: We have one problem at a time. We have Delilah, and we will deal with--

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: What do you want to do with Delilah?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: She's been stuffed into the Bag of Holding.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: We're going to talk to her. We're going to see what we can learn. We're going to be very thoughtful about what we talk to her about, and we're going to find a way of making sure that this is the last time we put her in the ground. By hook or by crook.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Don't cry on camera and then have to blow your nose a bunch!

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: She says to a nearby tree.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Should we try killing an animal and seeing how many diamonds you get out of it?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I can't try anything today.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Okay, we have to wait.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Tomorrow, we go to Kraghammer, we make an animal.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: We don't have the mansion tonight.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: No.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Do you want to Speak with Dead before bed, or do you want to sleep on it?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: We don't need the mansion; I got all my hit points. I'm good.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I don't think I'm in the right mind to even think of anything to say to her that isn't just rage, at the moment.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: We need to get up in a tree. I don't know what's in this area. I saw some tracks that didn't look friendly.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Let's get up there.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Aren't these trees dangerous in their own right?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: They seem like they've quieted down.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: We healed this forest; it should thank us.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Okay. Did the bow talk to the trees or anything? Fenthras.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Interesting. With the natural 20 nature check you made earlier: there is, I don't want to say, not a kinship, but a sense of understanding between you and the surrounding forest. It's hard to explain, and you haven't really had this sense before; this is more a Keyleth territory of having this connection with nature. But it's because you wield Fenthras and were responsible in a large way for cleansing this landscape, that as you begin to approach and look for trees for a place to sleep, you watch as one tree, the branches seem to bend down to form a small ladder. You watch as the boughs above separate and create an easy-to-lay-down cluster of branches and leaves.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Small miracles.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: They like us now.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Thank you.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: You guys crash; I'll take first watch.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I'm going to pull the armor up so we can keep it. Did you want--

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Yeah. We cuddle between the armor.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: That's weird. I'm not getting into it.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: That's the saddest thing.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: That's pretty sad. All right. The rest of you find yourselves to a night's rest, seemingly protected for the time being by the surrounding Shademirk Forest, no longer the Shademirk Bog. And unconsciousness takes you, Grog taking first watch. Now, I'm going to ask you guys, if you wouldn't mind, to step into the kitchen.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: What, me?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Everybody but Grog?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Everybody but Liam.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh fuck me running. We're jacking off.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Jacking off. Oh man.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: No, I feel like you're going to make plans.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: What are you going to do while we're not in here?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Go.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: A whole new show.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Spin-off.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Getting tangled?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Don't die forever.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: As your feet touch her palm, the silk web seems to loosen. You cast off the threads and fall to your hands and knees. You take a moment, and you hear that soft voice once more. "My champion, you "return to me and tear a swath through the tapestry. Please, be calm. My sight can pierce "many veils, but you've been hidden from my sight in recent days, and I am worried what foulness has "turned its intent upon us. Now, here you come to me, your very thread frayed and soul "transitioning. An unexpected destiny for my beautiful fate-touched." One of her fingers curls through your hair at the back of your head. "Tell me what you have seen."

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Your enemy.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "I have many enemies."

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Vecna.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "What does this Vecna intend?"

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: The world is in danger.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "How so? How can one man be this dangerous? What does he intend? What have you learned?"

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I don't know.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "I wonder why he guards my sight. Well." She goes into quiet contemplation for a moment. You see the strands of hair that emanate from the sides of the mask slowly shifting like waves on an ocean. "This Vecna comes to your world to be a king?"

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: That or grind us all into dust.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "This is historical. Mortals continuously intend to find others to grind into dust. If this "being has the power to block my sight, he has power beyond a mortal realm. Did you see anything? "Anything else?"

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: We traveled to the Shadowfell. There was a tower, and he had servants. He had powerful servants. A woman that we've fought before, and another, a man, a creature. I don't know. With a blade, a dark blade. And he was too powerful for us. He crushed us.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "And in your short spark with him, you learned nothing more of his plan? "No hint of what he's plotting?"

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: He threw me to the ground the first second he laid his eye on me. He murdered my sister. I thought we had come to an arrangement.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "We have."

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Where is my sister?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "She lives, still. She is beyond my influence. However, your body is ash, and your "soul is steeped in the divine energies that uphold the paths between life and death. You've earned "your eternal rest." The mask begins to recede into the darkness.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: No. No! Come back. No! I will not leave them behind. I want to help them, still.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "You truly see, to seek this, to bring it to its end?"

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Whatever it takes.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Do you accept my gift?"

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: You have such loneliness in your eyes.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Perhaps you will keep me company when you come back to me. Do you accept?"

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I do.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Then so be it. You, whose nature bucks destiny, my beautiful thing. Go. Share what you "have shared with me with others like me. Take what you can learn of this Vecna's plans, for if he can "block his intent from one, who knows what he plots against the other powers beyond the gate? Learn "from them. Ask them. You have my blessing. They have theirs to give, as well, and they may be all "that stands between the ruin of this world and you. Let their blessings turn the tides, "Vax'ildan. But use your time wisely, for corruption like this waits for no one. Now." She pulls your head down and kisses you on the forehead and brings your head close to hers, and you hear a voice whisper right into your ear, ever so faintly. "Wake up!" We need to go ahead and retrieve the rest of the cast now, if you wouldn't mind stepping aside.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Sure.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Thank you. (sighs, laughs) That's interesting. I'm here in silence. How creepy is this? I never get to talk with you guys at the table by myself. I don't even know what to do. Oh, they enter now. (laughs) Welcome back! Come, have a seat! Plug in!

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Why did you go so far away?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Jack in.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: By the way, audience, Travis pointed out as we left, they might not know what we were talking about when we all said, "oh, we're going to jack off now." It means unplug our microphone cords.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Oh yeah, that's actually a pretty good--

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: We're not--

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Performing illicit acts.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I am, but everyone else isn't.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: To each their own, I suppose.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: That's the hard part.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Why was Liam crying in the hallway?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: (laughs)

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Sam's scamming you.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Jacking in.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Jacking in.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: What happened?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: (laughter)

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: We had to hide at the other end of the building, man. That was nuts.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: So as you make your watch. Who's making second watch?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I'll take both.

lines.name: TALIESIN, LAURA
lines.text: No.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: You need to rest.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I don't, boo.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Yeah, you do. You need to sleep.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: You don't want to be exhausted.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: You've got to get your spells back, man.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yeah.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: How long does he have to rest so he's not exhausted?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Long rest.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: These are all long rests. We're all getting long rests. I'll take second watch.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I'm already exhausted. I frenzied last.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yeah, so if you don't rest, you don't get rid of that point of exhaustion.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: We've all learned what happens when I get two points of exhaustion. Good things.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Vecna comes back, and we all die.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Vecna is back.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right, so Percival, second watch? Perception check.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: That'll do. That's a 21.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Final watch is?

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: I'll take it.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Pike. Final watch. Perception check.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: 19, okay. While there is no real change from day to night in the Feywild, it's in that perpetual nearly dusk, sunset, purple-orange skyline, which you can see elements of creeping through since you're higher up in the brush of the forest. You do hear the shifting of sounds. The evening owl hooting has changed to more gentle bird chirps and sounds that would usually befit birds that lead to morning to you. Whether that be the forest itself, its natural cycle, or it altering to fit your cycle of sleep. At the end of your watch-- you've had your full rest, but are still a little groggy, you hear what sounds like the crushing of leaves on the ground below you.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: I'm going to try to hop up and hide in the tree. I guess I'm looking awake in the tree.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay. You're up in the tree, still. You glance down.

lines.text: 22. (laughs) Passive wisdom. As you carefully stay in the tree, you shake your head a bit, wandering into this opening here, not quite sure where you are as your senses are coming to, and you hear this slight scraping of something against bark. You immediately glance up and can see the small shine of a silver-and-brass set of armor as a tiny gnome is currently held up into the boughs of a tree.

lines.text: The naturally sensitive ears, even in a sleeping state, that are Vex's, being the wild hunter you are, you hear a suddenly loud voice below that catches your attention, and your eyes flicker open.

lines.text: Now as you notice, now that you've lost focus from the fact that he's there, you can see where previously, there was a small, darkened spot on his chest that looked like a bruise of some kind that never quite went away, it has expanded a bit to be almost in the shape of wings across the front of the chest.

lines.name: LIAM

lines.text: I'm going to fall down on the ground.

lines.text: How did this happen?

lines.text: Years ago.

lines.text: If we defeat him, do you go away?

lines.text: Yeah.

lines.text: One lucky winner's going to get this when we come back from the break, so if you want to be part of this giveaway, go over to the Twitch chat and enter when it's requested by the chat, enter the word "raven." We'll have a winner for you when we get back.

lines.name: SAM, TRAVIS
